ticket.title: Session cookie not sent with activerecord or memcache store in Rails 2.3.9
ticket.original-body:
Commit [f8f3653](http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/f8f3653) broke setting the session ID cookie for requests without 'HTTP_COOKIE' header when using activerecord or memcache store. Integration tests didn't catch this because they always set the HTTP_COOKIE header for mock requests, so now this is changed to only set the header if there are cookies.
[Fixed by b773d86 in my fork](http://github.com/mislav/rails/commit/b773d8698993810e9fecc78b71f98acb911ababa)
ticket.latest-body:
Commit [f8f3653](http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/f8f3653) broke setting the session ID cookie for requests without 'HTTP_COOKIE' header when using activerecord or memcache store. Integration tests didn't catch this because they always set the HTTP_COOKIE header for mock requests, so now this is changed to only set the header if there are cookies.
[Fixed by b773d86 in my fork](http://github.com/mislav/rails/commit/b773d8698993810e9fecc78b71f98acb911ababa)
ticket.original-body-html:
Commit f8f3653 broke setting the session ID cookie for requests without 'HTTP_COOKIE' header
when using activerecord or memcache store. Integration tests didn't catch this because they
always set the HTTP_COOKIE header for mock requests, so now this is changed to only set the
header if there are cookies.

Fixed by b773d86 in my fork

version.title: Session cookie not sent with activerecord or memcache store in Rails 2.3.9

version.body:
Just published an [unobtrusive fix for existing apps](http://gist.github.com/570149).
wget http://gist.github.com/570149.txt -O config/initializers/sessions_patch.rb
version.body-html:
Just published an unobtrusive fix for existing apps.

wget http://gist.github.com/570149.txt -O config/initializers/sessions_patch.rb
version.title: Session cookie not sent with activerecord or memcache store in Rails 2.3.9

version.body:
(from [c6e33d30c1fe02e5729a269ab577967fb59a5e6c]) fix setting session cookie with activerecord and memcache store
Commit f8f3653 broke setting the session ID cookie for requests without 'HTTP_COOKIE' header when using activerecord or memcache store. Integration tests didn't catch this because they always set the HTTP_COOKIE header for mock requests, so now this is changed to only set the header if there are cookies.
[#5581 state:committed]
Signed-off-by: Santiago Pastorino <santiago@wyeworks.com> http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/c6e33d30c1fe02e5729a269ab577967fb59a5e6c
version.body-html:
(from [c6e33d30c1fe02e5729a269ab577967fb59a5e6c]) fix setting session cookie with activerecord and memcache store

Commit f8f3653 broke setting the session ID cookie for requests without 'HTTP_COOKIE' header
when using activerecord or memcache store. Integration tests didn't catch this because they
always set the HTTP_COOKIE header for mock requests, so now this is changed to only set the
header if there are cookies.

[#5581 state:committed]

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pastorino santiago@wyeworks.com
http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/c6e33d30c1fe02e5729a269ab57796...
version.title: Session cookie not sent with activerecord or memcache store in Rails 2.3.9

version.body: Is this going to result in a 2.3.10? Seems like a pretty serious issue that would affect a lot of people, no? Or has everyone moved on to Cookie store?
version.body-html: Is this going to result in a 2.3.10? Seems like a pretty serious issue that would affect a lot of people, no? Or has everyone moved on to Cookie store?
version.title: Session cookie not sent with activerecord or memcache store in Rails 2.3.9

version.body: I'd like to know too if there is a Rails 2.3.10 being planned. I'm using ActiveRecord as the session store in my app due to data sensitivity and this bug killed by 2.3.9 upgrade. There are still a lot of valid reasons for not using cookies to store sessions - data sensitivity and the bandwidth used to upload all session data on every request are the two biggest that I can think of.
version.body-html: I'd like to know too if there is a Rails 2.3.10 being planned. I'm using ActiveRecord as the session store in my app due to data sensitivity and this bug killed by 2.3.9 upgrade. There are still a lot of valid reasons for not using cookies to store sessions - data sensitivity and the bandwidth used to upload all session data on every request are the two biggest that I can think of.
version.title: Session cookie not sent with activerecord or memcache store in Rails 2.3.9
Session cookie not sent with activerecord or memcache store in Rails 2.3.9

version.body:
+1 it stopped us upgrading.
Mislav's fix will do us for now, but it doesn't make a great impression when an app just plum stops working on upgrade. We have an ActiveRecord session store.

version.title: Session cookie not sent with activerecord or memcache store in Rails 2.3.9

version.body: Guys, I appreciate the +1s, but the core team were already aware and will incorporate this in the next release. If you want to nudge them to release sooner, write on the core mailing list! Thanks ;)
version.body-html: Guys, I appreciate the +1s, but the core team were already aware and will incorporate this in the next release. If you want to nudge them to release sooner, write on the core mailing list! Thanks ;)
